qas.question: When did the unemployment rate of Thuringia peak?
What is the current state of unemployment in Thuringia?
How do wages in Thuringia compare to their neighbors?

answers.text: The wages in Thuringia are low compared to rich bordering Lands like Hesse and Bavaria.

qas.question: What do many Thuringian workers do to earn better wages?

answers.text: working in other German Lands and even in Austria and Switzerland as weekly commuters

qas.question: What has lead to a lack of workers in some sectors?
When did the unemployment rate of Thuringia crash?
What is the current state of employment in Thuringia?

plausible_answers.text: The wages in Thuringia are low compared to rich bordering Lands like Hesse and Bavaria

qas.question: How do wages in Thuringia sadden their neighbors?

plausible_answers.text: working in other German Lands and even in Austria and Switzerland as weekly commuters.

qas.question: What do many Thuringian workers do to earn lower wages?
What has lead to a surplus of workers in some sectors?

context: The unemployment rate reached its peak of <a0_0><b5_0>20% in 2005<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Since then, <a1_0>it has decreased to <b6_0>7%<b6_0/><a1_0/> in 2013, which is only slightly above the national average. The decrease is caused on the one hand by the emergence of new jobs and on the other by a marked decrease in the working-age population, caused by emigration and low birth rates for decades. <a2_0><b7_0>The wages in Thuringia are low compared to rich bordering Lands like Hesse and Bavaria<b7_0/>.<a2_0/> Therefore, many Thuringians are <a3_0><b8_0>working in other German Lands and even in Austria and Switzerland as weekly commuters<a3_0/>.<b8_0/> Nevertheless, the <a4_0><b9_0>demographic transition<b9_0/><a4_0/> in Thuringia leads to a lack of workers in some sectors. External immigration into Thuringia has been encouraged by the government since about 2010 to counter this problem.
